events.message: Customer reported a collision involving their vehicle and another car on a busy intersection, resulting in visible damage.
The claim was assessed and properly categorized under Auto Accident based on the keywords and description provided.
An experienced claims agent was assigned to handle the customer's case to expedite the processing.
The customer received official acknowledgment that their claim was received and is under review.
Additional documents such as police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and repair estimates were requested from the customer.
Customer submitted all requested documents including accident report, vehicle damage photos, and insurance policy details.
Claims investigator began reviewing the submitted documentation and contacted witnesses to verify the accident details.
The investigation concluded with confirmation of fault and verification of damage extent consistent with reported collision.
A settlement offer was proposed covering the repair costs and rental vehicle expenses during the repair period.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the prompt settlement proposal and appreciated the clear communication throughout.
The claim was officially approved by the claims department following acceptance of the settlement terms by the customer.
Payment was processed and issued to the customer's preferred account covering the full settlement amount.
The case was formally closed following confirmation that repairs were completed and payment was received.
